notesStmt.note: Folio 2r contains some doodles. Ish ger, i.e. Abraham Joseph S. Grazziano: inscribed (at the top of folio 3r). Camillo Jaghel: inscribed with his name, 1613 (folio 92v); see 50-56. Renato da Modena: inscribed with his name, 1626 (folio 126v); see 132-133.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 208: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed, folio [128v].
